intro: Cupaniopsis multijuga, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cupaniopsis, is a small evergreen shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. It produces woody capsules as fruit, which contain small, round seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
